statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: USC Upstate takes down Montreat 101-55
article.story: SPARTANBURG, S.C. -- Ty Greene scored 18 points and had five steals as USC Upstate beat NAIA member Montreat 101-55 on Tuesday night. Josh Cuthbertson had 14 points, on 7-of-12 shooting, with seven rebounds and seven assists for Upstate (10-4). Ramel Thompkins, Jacob Schulte and Tristan Thomas had 12 points apiece and Michael Buchanan added 10. Upstate won its 10th game before the start of January for the first time in school history. Will Lewis led Montreat with 14 points and Joshua Foster had 11. The Cavaliers were held to 19-of-50 shooting (38 percent), turned the ball over 22 times and were outrebounded 41-27. Upstate jumped out to a 50-19 lead by halftime and opened the second half on a 14-5 run for a 40-point lead. It was Upstate's third time over the century mark this season -- all against non-Division I opponents.
